intro: Capnoides heterocarpa, commonly known as the wild quinine plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, dry seeds. The botanical features of Capnoides heterocarpa make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
